data.title: 10 Museums In Australia For The History Buffs To Visit In 2023
data.meta_description: Australian Museum, Scienceworks, Melbourne Museum, and National Museum of Australia are some of the best museums in Australia that tourists can visit in 2023'.
data.text:
Australia, which is officially known as the Commonwealth of Australia is a sovereign country with a rich history. So, if you ever plan to study the cultural, scientific, artistic and historical aspects of Australia, the best thing to do is to visit the Museums in Australia. The museums will help you gain an apt understanding of Australian culture as well as the achievements of Australia throughout. This article will give you all the information about the best Museums to visit in Australia to enhance your knowledge.

10 Best Museums In Australia

If you don’t want to explore only the happening spots of Australia, the museums of the country will leave you with many stories of their glorious past.

Melbourne Museum

The National Museum Of Australia

Australian Museum

Australian National Maritime Museum

Scienceworks

Queensland Museum

Powerhouse Museum

Questacon

Australian War Memorial

National Sports Museum

1. Melbourne Museum

Image Source

Melbourne Museum is one of the largest museums in the Southern Hemisphere. This museum talks about the history of the place, beginning from the origin of life in the Victoria region in the past 600 million years. You can explore the seas, view prehistoric creatures and also have a quick look at the ancestral spirit Bunjil in the special designed Bunjilaka Aboriginal Cultural Centre. You can also watch a movie in the museum complex itself in IMAX theatres.

Opening and closing time of the museum: Mon-Sun: 10:00 am – 5:00 pm

Location: 11 Nicholson St, Carlton VIC Australia

contact No: +61 03 8341 7777

Entry Fees: Adult- $25.50, Child (to 16 years) – $12 , Family (Two adults and two children)- $70

Australia Honeymoon Packages On TravelTriangle

Go on a luxurious honeymoon trip to Australia and witness the best of marine life at the Great Barrier Reef. Indulge in Australia’s aquatic experiences, go for nature walks, and get the best of food & wine. Find best honeymoon deals offered only on TravelTriangle.

2. The National Museum Of Australia

Image Source

The National Museum of Australia places special emphasis on three aspects of Australian history i.e. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures and histories, Australia and its environment and Australian society and history 1788. The museum doesn’t talk about history only but it has special attractions such as Phar Laps heart and the Square, Captain Cook’s navigational instruments and Arched and Round windows from Play School. This is one of the best Australian museums!

Opening and closing time of the museum: 9 am to 5 pm daily (closed Christmas Day)

Location: Lawson Crescent, Acton Peninsula, Canberra ACT 2601

contact No: +61 2 6208 5000

Entry Fees: Children (0-4 years)- Free, Family (2 Adults, 2 Children)- $30, Family (1 Adult, 2 Children)- $15

Must Read: 10 Adventurous Theme Parks In Australia To Beat The Heat & Quench That Adrenaline Rush!

3. Australian Museum

Image Source

This museum was established in the year 1827 and became the first public museum in the country. The museum is a hub of an awesome collection of about 18 million objects of scientific and cultural significance across the three floors museum. One of the best museums in Australia, this is a must-visit!

Opening and closing time of the museum: 9:30 am to 5 pm daily (closed Christmas Day)

Location: 1 William St, Sydney NSW Australia

contact No: +61 2 9320 6000

Entry Fees: Adult- $15

4. Australian National Maritime Museum

Image Source

Among all the museums of Australia, this museum is special as it is surrounded by ocean from all sides & it is the witness of the maritime past. Since 1991, the museum plays an essential role in the construction of Australian naval story. The main galleries of the museum emphasize the indigenous relationship between Australians and water, water travel and recreation, the discovery of Australia and it’s navy. The fun part- you also have an opportunity to explore three water vessels at this museum.

Opening and closing time of the museum: Every Day 9:30 am – 5:00 pm, Extended to 6:00 pm in January, Last boarding time for Submarine and Tall Ships – 4.10pm, Closed Christmas Day 25 December.

Location: 2 Murray Street, Darling Harbour, Sydney NSW 2000, AU

contact No: +61 2 9298 3777

Entry Fees: In 3D cinema- Adult: $32, Child (under 4): FREE ,Child (4–15): $20 , Family: $79 (includes 2 adults and up to 3 children aged 4-15), Concession: $20 (Australian full-time student card, ISIC – International Student Card, Australian or New Zealand Senior, Australian Pensioner), Members: FREE

Suggested Read: 15 Best Hotels In Australia For Those Who Want Nothing But The Best!

5. Scienceworks

Image Source

The science is another pillar of human survival, which you can witness via the naked eye. Yes, you can in the Scienceworks Museum of Australia. After witnessing the magic of science you can build the connection between Melbourne’s industry, its heritage as well as applied technology. You can see a voyage into deep space at the Planetarium region; you can also take a quick tour to the century-old Pumping Station also gain knowledge about the scientific concept behind Spotswood. A bonus for all the visitors is an electrifying presentation in the Lighting Room. Don’t forget to add this museum to your list of museums in Australia!

Opening and closing time of the museum: Daily 10 am–4.30pm. Closed Good Friday and Christmas Day

Location: 2 Booker St, Spotswood VIC Australia

contact No: +61 3 9392 4800

Entry Fees: Adult Scienceworks only- $15, Child Scienceworks only (to 16 years) – free of cost.

6. Queensland Museum

Image Source

The museum is rich in the natural history of Australian cultural heritage, science as well as a human achievement. The museum hosts the World Science Festival which is why it is one of the most visited museums in Australia. The Queensland Museum talks about the story of the sunshine state.

Opening and closing time of the museum: Open daily from 9.30am – 5 pm, Closed Good Friday, Christmas Day & Boxing Day. Open ANZAC Day from 1.30 pm.

Location: Queensland Museum, Grey St & Melbourne St South Brisbane 4101, Queensland

contact No: +61 (0)7 3840 7555

Entry Fees: Free of cost

Suggested Read: Australia’s Bubble Tent For An Incredible Glamping & Stargazing Experience In The Wilderness

7. Powerhouse Museum

Image Source

It is a converted powerhouse and contains an eclectic collection. This museum houses an astounding collection of approximately 400,000 artifacts ranging from science, design, communication, engineering, and space to fashion and contemporary culture. IT has built its unique collection since its establishment in 1879. The most famous artifacts housed here include Locomotive No. 1 and The Kings Cinema.

Opening and closing time of the museum: Open daily from 10.00 AM to 5.00 P.M.

Location: 500 Harris Street Ultimo NSW Australia,

contact No: +61 2 9217 0111

Entry Fees: Free of cost

Must Read: 7 Lakes In Australia That Will Pamper The Nature Lover In You!

8. Questacon

Image Source

This museum which was set up in 1988 houses more than 200 interactive exhibits. It seeks to enlighten curious minds about science and technology. There are eight themed galleries in the museum which offer hands-on activities and demonstrations The exhibits range from prehistoric times to meteorology, photography, and engineering.

Opening and closing time of the museum: Open daily from 10.00 AM to 5.00 P.M.

Location: National Portrait Gallery, 35 King Edward Terrace, Parkes ACT Australia,

Contact no : +61 2 6270 2800

Entry Fees: $ 23 for adults

9. Australian War Memorial

Image Source

The solemn war memorial aims at commemorating the Australian members of the armed forces who laid down their lives in the war. A shrine, a museum, and a research centre together make up this Australian War Memorial that tells a great deal about the sacrifices of these young soldiers long ago. The museum was established in 1941 and is more than just another of those historical museums in Australia that recount tales of the past. In the very heart of the memorial stands the Hall of Memory containing the Tomb of the Unknown Australian Soldier and the Roll of Honour, on which are inscribed the names of more than 102,000 Australians. One can also attend various exhibitions and see the outdoor Sculpture Garden at this memorial from time to time.

Location: Treloar Cres, Campbell ACT 2612, Australia

Opening hours: 10 AM – 5 PM

10. National Sports Museum

Image Source

Showcasing Australia’s sporting achievement, the National Sports Museum situated at the MCG is amongst the most fun museums in Australia. The vast place features the Sport Australia Hall of Fame, the Australian Cricket Hall of Fame, as well as the Australian Football Hall of Fame along with 3,500 artifacts like the Melbourne Cup trophies and Olympic medals. Visitors also get to indulge in various interactive experiences and holograms of Shane Warne and James Hird which are some of the most interesting aspects of this museum.

Location: Melbourne Cricket Ground, Brunton Ave, Melbourne VIC 3000, Australia

Opening hours: 10 AM – 5 PM

Entry fee: INR 675/-

Further Read: 15 Reasons Why Spending Winter In Australia Is Better Than Being Anywhere Else!

Frequently Asked Questions About Famous Museums In Australia

Which are the best art museums in Australia?

Museum of Contemporary Art and The University of Queensland Art Museum are some of the best art museums in Australia.

Which are the famous museums in Perth, Australia?

Western Australian Museum and Perth Institute of Contemporary Arts are some of the famous museums in Perth, Australia.
